title: Understand Substitution Method
text: The substitution method involves expressing one variable in terms of the other using one of the equations. Then substitute this expression into the other equation to solve for one of the variables.

title: Choose an Equation to Rearrange
text: Pick one of the equations and solve it for one of the variables. This makes substitution easier.

title: Rearrange the First Equation
text: Let's rearrange the first equation $$-2x+3y=1.2$$ to express $$y$$ in terms of $$x$$. What do you get?

title: Substitute into the Second Equation
text: Substitute $$y=\frac{2}{3} x+0.4$$ into the second equation $$-3x-6y=1.8$$. What equation do you get?

title: Simplify the Substituted Equation
text: Simplify the equation $$-3x-6\left(\frac{2}{3} x+0.4\right)=1.8$$. What is the solution for $$x$$?

title: Find $$y$$ Using $$x$$
text: Substitute $$x=-0.6$$ back into $$y=\frac{2}{3} x+0.4$$ to find $$y$$. What is $$y$$?

title: Check Your Solution
text: After finding values for both $$x$$ and $$y$$, it's good practice to substitute them back into the original equations to verify the solution is correct.
